event.title: Cycles
event.name: CPU Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts instruction memory accesses that cause a refill of at least the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. This includes each instruction memory access that causes a refill from outside the cache. It excludes accesses that do not cause a new cache refill but are satisfied from refilling data of a previous miss.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts instruction memory accesses that cause a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 instruction TLB. This includes each instruction memory access that causes an access to a level of memory system due to a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside the Level 1 cache. Each access that causes a new linefill is counted, including those from instructions that generate multiple accesses, such as load or store multiples, and PUSH and POP instructions. In particular, the counter counts accesses to the Level 1 cache that cause a refill that is satisfied by another Level 1 data or unified cache, or a Level 2 cache, or memory.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a cache access to at least the Level 1 data or unified cache. Each access to a cache line is counted including the multiple accesses of instructions, such as LDM or STM . Each access to other Level 1 data or unified memory structures, for example refill buffers, write buffers, and write- back buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts each memory-read operation or memory-write operation that causes a TLB refill of at least the Level 1 data or unified TLB. It counts each read or write that causes a refill, in the form of a translation table walk or an access to another level of TLB caching.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter increments for every architecturally executed instruction.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Taken
event.description: The counter increments for each exception taken. The counter counts only the processor exceptions. It does not count untrapped floating-point exceptions or ThumbEE null checks and index checks.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Exception Returns
event.description: The counter increments for each executed exception return instruction.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to CONTEXTIDR
event.description: The counter increments for every write to the CONTEXTIDR.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Mispredictions
event.description: The counter counts each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction from, or no prediction from, the branch prediction resources and that relates to instructions that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Possible Predictions
event.description: The counter counts every branch or other change in the program flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts memory-read or memory-write operations that the processor made. The counter increments whether the access results in an access to a Level 1 data or unified cache, a Level 2 data or unified cache, or neither of these.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts instruction memory accesses that access at least the Level 1 instruction or unified cache. Each access to other Level 1 instruction memory structures, such as refill buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: The counter counts every write-back of data from the Level 1 data or unified cache. The counter counts each write-back that causes data to be written from the Level 1 cache to outside of the Level 1 cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts memory-read or memory-write operations, that the processor made, that access at least the Level 2 data or unified cache. Each access to a cache line is counted including refills of and write-backs from the Level 1 data, instruction, or unified caches. Each access to other Level 2 data or unified memory structures , such as refill buffers, write buffers, and write-back buffers, is also counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: The counter counts memory-read or memory-write operations, that the processor made, that access at least the Level 2 data or unified cache and cause a refill of a Level 1 data , instruction, or unified cache or of the Level 2 data or unified cache. Each read from or write to the cache that causes a refill from outside the Level 1 and Level 2 caches is counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: The counter counts every write-back of data from the Level 2 data or unified cache that occurs as a result of an operation by this processor. It counts each write-back that causes data to be written from the Level 2 cache to outside the Level 1 and Level 2 caches.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: The counter counts memory-read or memory-write operations that access outside of the boundary of the processor and its closely-coupled caches . Where this boundary lies with respect to any implemented caches is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED. It must count accesses beyond the cache furthest from the processor for which accesses can be counted.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter counts instructions that are speculatively executed by the processor. This includes instructions that are subsequently not architecturally executed. As a result, this event counts a larger number of instructions than the number of instructions architecturally executed.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to TTBR
event.description: The counter counts writes to the translation table base registers, TTBR0 and TTBR1.

event.title: Cycles
event.name: Bus Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle of the external memory interface of the processor.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory read accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory write accesses.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory-read operations that access at least the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Access', but counts only memory-write operations that access at least the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (due to reuse)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Write-back', but counts only write-backs that are a result of the line being allocated for an access made by the processor.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back (due to clean)
event.description: As 'L2 Data Cache: Write-back', but counts only write-backs that are a result of a coherency operation made by another processor, or from a CP15 cache maintenance operation. Whether write-backs made as a result of CP15 cache maintenance operations are counted is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Invalidation
event.description: The counter counts each invalidation of a cache line in the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (Normal, Cacheable, Shareable)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-read and memory-write operations that make "Normal, Cacheable, Shareable" accesses outside the boundary of the processor and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (NOT Normal, Cacheable, Shareable)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-read and memory-write operations that make not "Normal, Cacheable, Shareable" accesses outside the boundary of the processor and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (Normal)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-read and memory-write operations that make "Normal, Cacheable" and "Normal, Non-cacheable" accesses outside the boundary of the processor and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (Device)
event.description: As 'Bus: Access', but counts only memory-read and memory-write operations that make "Device" accesses outside the boundary of the processor and its closely-coupled caches.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only memory-read operations that the processor made.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only memory-write operations that the processor made.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to unaligned read)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only unaligned memory-read operations that the processor made. It also counts unaligned accesses if they are subsequently changed into multiple aligned accesses.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to unaligned write)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only unaligned memory-write operations that the processor made. It also counts unaligned accesses if they are subsequently changed into multiple aligned accesses.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to unaligned read or write)
event.description: As 'Memory: Access', but the counter counts only unaligned memory-read and unaligned memory-write operations that the processor made. It also counts unaligned accesses if they are subsequently changed into multiple aligned accesses.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load-Exclusive
event.description: The counter counts Load-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store-Exclusive (Failures)
event.description: The counter counts Store-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed that fail to complete a write. It is within the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED definition of speculatively executed whether this includes conditional instructions that fail the condition code check.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store-Exclusive
event.description: The counter counts Store-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' event.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Store' event.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading and memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' and 'Instructions (Executed): Store' events.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Integer)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only integer data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Advanced SIMD)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Advanced SIMD data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Floating-point)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only floating-point data-processing instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (software PC writes)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only software changes of the PC.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (immediate)
event.description: The counter counts immediate branch instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (return)
event.description: The counter counts procedure return instructions speculatively executed.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (indirect)
event.description: The counter counts indirect branch instructions speculatively executed. This includes software change of the PC other than exception-generating instructions and immediate branch instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Barrier (ISB)
event.description: The counter counts Instruction Synchronization Barrier instructions speculatively executed, including CP15ISB.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Barrier (DSB)
event.description: The counter counts data synchronization barrier instructions speculatively executed, including CP15DSB.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Barrier (DMB)
event.description: The counter counts data memory barrier instructions speculatively executed, including CP15DSB. It does not include the implied barrier operations of load/store operations with release consistency semantics.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Undefined
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are not counted by 'Exceptions: SVC', 'Exceptions: SMC', 'Exceptions: HVC', 'Exceptions: Instruction Abort', 'Exceptions: Data Abort', 'Exceptions: IRQ', and 'Exceptions: FIQ'.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: HVC
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions that are Hypervisor Call exceptions including both those taken locally and from non-secure EL1/PL1.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Linefill)
event.description: Instruction side stalled due to a linefill.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Translation Table Walk)
event.description: Instruction side stalled due to a translation table walk.

event.title: Instruction Cache
event.name: Number of ways read (Tag RAM)
event.description: Number of ways read in the instruction cache - Tag RAM.

event.title: Instruction Cache
event.name: Number of ways read (Data RAM)
event.description: Number of ways read in the instruction cache - Data RAM.

event.title: Instruction Cache
event.name: Number of ways read (BTAC RAM)
event.description: Number of ways read in the instruction BTAC RAM.

event.title: Snoop Control Unit
event.name: Data Snoop
event.description: SCU Snooped data from another core for this core.

event.title: Load-Store Unit
event.name: All Slots Busy
event.description: Duration during which all slots in the Load-Store Unit are busy.

event.title: Issue Queue Full
event.name: Load-Store
event.description: Duration during which all slots in the Load-Store Issue queue are busy.

event.title: Issue Queue Full
event.name: Data Processing
event.description: Duration during which all slots in the Data Processing issue queue are busy.

event.title: Issue Queue Full
event.name: Data Engine
event.description: Duration during which all slots in the Data Engine issue queue are busy.

event.title: NEON
event.name: Conditional Code Flush
event.description: Number of NEON instruction which fail their condition code and lead to a flush of the DE pipe.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Trap (Hyp)
event.description: Number of Trap to hypervisor.

event.title: PTM
event.name: Ext Out[0]
event.description: PTM Ext Out[0].

event.title: PTM
event.name: Ext Out[1]
event.description: PTM Ext Out[1].

event.title: MMU
event.name: Translation Table Walk
event.description: Duration during which the MMU handle a translation table walk.

event.title: MMU
event.name: Translation Table Walk (Stage 1)
event.description: Duration during which the MMU handle a Stage1 translation table walk.

event.title: MMU
event.name: Translation Table Walk (Stage 2)
event.description: Duration during which the MMU handle a Stage2 translation table walk.

event.title: MMU
event.name: Translation Table Walk (due to Load-Store)
event.description: Duration during which the MMU handle a translation table walk requested by the Load Store Unit.

event.title: MMU
event.name: Translation Table Walk (due to Instruction)
event.description: Duration during which the MMU handle a translation table walk requested by the Instruction side.

event.title: MMU
event.name: Translation Table Walk (due to Preload/Prefetch)
event.description: Duration during which the MMU handle a translation table walk requested by a Preload instruction or Prefetch request.

event.title: MMU
event.name: Translation Table Walk (due to CP15 insn)
event.description: Duration during which the MMU handle a translation table walk requested by a CP15 operation (maintenance by MVA and VA-to-PA operation).

event.title: L1 TLB
event.name: Refill (Preload)
event.description: Level 1 Preload TLB refill.

event.title: L1 TLB
event.name: Refill (CP15)
event.description: Level 1 CP15 TLB refill.

event.title: L1 TLB
event.name: Flush
event.description: Level 1 TLB flush.

event.title: L2 TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 2 TLB access.

event.title: L2 TLB
event.name: Miss
event.description: Level 2 TLB miss.
